channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Protests in Turkey Over Istanbul Mayor’s Detention: What to Know About the Turmoil
item.description: The arrest of Istanbul’s mayor on corruption charges has stoked worries that President Recep Tayyip Erdogan is becoming more authoritarian in seeking ...

item.title: Female breadwinners represent just 16% of all households, but account for 42% of divorces
item.description: Women who out-earn their husbands have options.

item.title: Why the CPO of Garner Health believes in a culture of ‘radical candor’
item.description: The health tech company encourages employees to write reviews of each other, which end up getting seen by everyone.

item.title: The Trump Train Is Going Full Speed Ahead
item.description: This is certainly an administration that reminds us why the framers decided on separation of powers.

item.title: BYD sales top Tesla as tech focus wins over Chinese drivers
item.description: Tesla still leads in market valuation, however: Elon Musk's EV maker is worth about $800 billion, while BYD's market cap is closer to $157 billion.

item.title: The Vicious Cycle of Extreme Heat Leading to More Fossil Fuel Use
item.description: A new report illustrates a concerning dynamic: Record heat last year pushed countries to use more planet-warming fossil fuels to cool things down.

item.title: Snow White built Disney into entertainment powerhouse, now its remake risks becoming a culture war casualty and its biggest flop
item.description: Its $43 million domestic box office fell well below initial projections amid 'Seven Kajillion Controversies" that mired the live-action musical remake...

item.title: Trump’s Moves on Greenland Appear to Be Backfiring
item.description: The Greenlandic government is calling an upcoming visit by Trump officials “aggressive,” pushing the island further from the United States.

item.title: L’Oréal and other beauty giants are pleading with the EU to exclude American cosmetics from its tariff war
item.description: A tit-for-tat tariff sweep from Europe is "going to penalize Europe much more than American businesses and companies," L’Oréal's CEO said.

item.title: Gérard Depardieu Appears in Court Over Sexual Assault Allegations
item.description: The French actor faces charges in a case involving two women working on the set of a movie in which he starred.

item.title: To Him, Americans Were Always Heroes. He’s Not So Sure About Today’s.
item.description: A tour led by an 88-year-old guide in Bastogne, Belgium, scene of a critical battle of World War II, offers a snapshot into the way President Trump’s ...

item.title: Lessons from a Lost-Pet Detective Named Kat
item.description: Recovering missing animals requires understanding both animal and human behavior.

item.title: Protests in Turkey Over Istanbul Mayor’s Detention: What to Know About the Turmoil
item.description: The arrest of Istanbul’s mayor on corruption charges has stoked worries that President Recep Tayyip Erdogan is becoming more authoritarian in seeking ...

item.title: Trump’s Moves on Greenland Appear to Be Backfiring
item.description: The Greenlandic government is calling an upcoming visit by Trump officials “aggressive,” pushing the island further from the United States.

item.title: Trump Did What Castros Couldn’t: Take Radio Martí Off the Air
item.description: For four decades, a U.S.-financed broadcaster provoked the ire of the communist government in Cuba. President Trump dismantled it in a matter of days.
